intro: Chabertia occidentalis, commonly known as western chabertia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
